intro: Tibouchina asperior, commonly known as rough tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Tibouchina asperior is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
